meanings.sent1: She souped up the bland broth with extra spices.
meanings.sent2: I souped my chicken noodle soup with some fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent3: He souped the soup with so much salt that it became inedible.
meanings.sent4: The chef souped up the tomato bisque with a hint of basil.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the souped broth filled the kitchen with warmth.

meanings.definition: To modify or improve, especially a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: They souped their old car with a new engine.
meanings.sent2: He souped his motorcycle to make it faster for the race.
meanings.sent3: She souped the bicycle with colorful streamers for fun.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic souped up the truck with turbocharged performance.
meanings.sent5: The racer souped his car to zoom past the competition.

meanings.definition: To make something more powerful or faster, especially a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The team souped their boat to break the speed record.
meanings.sent2: He souped his skateboard to impress his friends with tricks.
meanings.sent3: She souped the lawnmower to finish the yard work quickly.
meanings.sent4: The engineer souped up the jet engine for maximum thrust.
meanings.sent5: The driver souped his car to zip through the winding roads.
